intro: Lasiosiphon somalensis var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in a fine, silky hair, though the varietal name 'glabra' suggests a smoother texture. This plant is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid habitats. Its blooming period typically occurs during the rainy season, adding a splash of color to the landscape.
